bug.short_desc: [1.8][compiler] Eclipse java compiler does not detect a bad return type in lambda expression

long_desc.thetext:
(In reply to Alessandro Nistico from comment #0) > The eclipse compiler does not detect a "bad return type in lambda > expression" when compiling the following class:
What is the version you are using ? I don't see the problem on master. I plan to add a regression test and close it WORKSFORME.

This is fixed as of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=422810. My doing time travel, I am able to confirm that problem exists just before the commit for the bug mentioned and ceases to exist just after.
junit released here: http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=c9d870e81c39ef346cd516aec8b582594228dd29
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 422810 ***
Thanks, fix for bug 422810 is on master, it is in the process of being back ported to 4.4.2 this week - so you can grab the maintenance stream build after that. Thanks.
Verified for 4.5 M5 using I20150127-0900 build
